name: operation, computer, desktop, with liquid crystal display, standby mode | operation, computer, desktop, with liquid crystal display, standby mode | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/2478/documentation

The computer desktop use in the standby/sleep mode includes the share of computer production (CPU, keyboard, mouse, LCD) as well as the energy consumption (use-phase) and the rail and road transport from factory to user. Energy consumption of computer CPUs and LCD monitors (use-phase) vary a lot depending on the computer looked at. Min.-Max. values are listed; the mean value is calculated via the most likely value according to the reference data. Due to relatively vague literature data for computer and LCD life span, assumptions had to be made.



Describes the use of a desktop computer with a LCD monitor in the standby/sleep mode. Calculated per 1 hour of computer use. Computer life span assumed to be 4 years, for the LCD monitor 6 years. Standby/sleep mode 2 hours a day (office use), 240 days a year. Swiss supply mix applied for electricity consumption (low voltage).
category: J:Information and communication/62:Computer programming, consultancy and related activities/620:Computer programming, consultancy and related activities

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The data is based on information by international computer manufacturers and literature (standby/sleep mode consumption).
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: No technology involved, except for the production of the desktop computer (including LCD, keyboard and mouse), which is described in another dataset.
